intro: Pavetta palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan pavetta, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a smooth texture. It produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. Pavetta palawanensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of lowland and montane forests.
